notes: Edit this file manually each time new CFP rankings are released. IDs must match ?team= values.

teams.name: Texas Tech

projection.movementText: Holding steady at #1 in most models.

teams.headline: Air Raid Reloaded, Eyes on Glendale
teams.summary: Texas Tech opens 2025 with a loaded offense and a defense that finally looks playoff-ready. This page tracks how every remaining game shapes their road to the national title.

bestCase.summary: Run the table, win the Big 12 title game convincingly, and lock the #1 seed. That likely means at least two ranked road wins and no one-score scares down the stretch.

mostLikely.summary: Drop one tricky conference game but still win the Big 12 and finish with multiple top-15 wins. Committee keeps them safely inside the top 4.

worstCase.summary: Injuries and turnover-heavy games lead to multiple losses, including the title game. Tech slides out of the top 4 and into the at-large chaos pile.

remainingSchedule.notes: Clean, drama-free win keeps them aligned with expectations.

riskFactors: New defensive coordinator still installing scheme.
QB depth behind starter is untested.

teams.name: Georgia

projection.movementText: Neck-and-neck with #1; any slip opens door to jump or slide.

teams.headline: Reload or Reign? Dawgs in Familiar Territory
teams.summary: Georgia once again starts inside the top 4. The question is less 'can they make the playoff' and more 'can anyone shove them out of it?'

bestCase.summary: Perfect regular season plus dominant SEC title win swings the #1 seed back to Athens.

mostLikely.summary: Survive the SEC with one blemish and another top-tier résumé. CFP lock unless chaos goes nuclear.

worstCase.summary: Multiple SEC losses and a missed title game push them into New Year’s Six territory instead of the bracket.

riskFactors: Replacing key NFL-bound starters on defense.
SEC schedule leaves no margin for sloppy weeks.
